items.title: `.languages.get` fails in py2.7 as of 20.7.2
items.body:
Not sure if you're still supporting python2 (I know, I know, we're working on it), but it looks like `languages.get` no longer works as of 20.7.2.

```
>>> import pycountry
>>> pycountry.languages.get(alpha_2='en')
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/Users/timothy.cloninger/.pyenv/versions/2.7.17/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pycountry/db.py", line 40, in load_if_needed
    self._load()
  File "/Users/timothy.cloninger/.pyenv/versions/2.7.17/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pycountry/db.py", line 67, in _load
    self.data_class_name, (self.data_class_base,), {})
TypeError: a new-style class can't have only classic bases
```

For now we're locked to 19.8.18, and will update as soon as the python3 migration is finished.

items.title: Kosovo missing
items.body:
Hi,

Kosovo has declared independance in 2008 and I think most software this days include them in their countries list.

items.title: Language code 'scr' not found
items.body: the language code 'scr'  (Croatian) was not found in the function pycontry.languages.lookup.

items.title: Python 2.7 TypeErrors
items.body:
The versions of July '20 cause `TypeErrors` with Python 2.7 checks:

```
platform linux2 -- Python 2.7.18, pytest-4.6.11, py-1.9.0, pluggy-0.13.1

self = <pycountry.Languages instance at 0x7fb28afcc500>
 
     def _load(self):
         if self._is_loaded:
             # Help keeping the _load_if_needed code easier
             # to read.
             return
         self.objects = []
         self.index_names = set()
         self.indices = {}
     
         self.data_class = type(
>           self.data_class_name, (self.data_class_base,), {})
E       TypeError: a new-style class can't have only classic bases
 
/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/2.7.18/x64/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pycountry/db.py:67: TypeError
```

items.title: pkg_resources import error
items.body:
In the latest version, `pkg_resources` is imported both inside and outside the exception handling, so on systems (like ours) that don't use pkg_resources it can't import.

This is in: https://github.com/flyingcircusio/pycountry/blob/master/src/pycountry/__init__.py

```python
# vim:fileencoding=utf-8
"""pycountry"""

import os.path
import unicodedata
import pycountry.db
import pkg_resources


try:
    import pkg_resources
    resource_filename = pkg_resources.resource_filename
    __version__ = pkg_resources.get_distribution("pycountry").version
except ImportError:
    __version__ = 'n/a'
    def resource_filename(package_or_requirement, resource_name):
        return os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), resource_name)
```

items.title: Minor units for currencies
items.body: Hello. Can we add minor units for currencies following ISO 4217:2015?

items.title: Missing MX-CMX from Mexico subdivisions
items.body:
The ISO-3166 standard changed the subdivision code MX-DIF to MX-CMX as of 2016-11-15. This is listed in the change history at the bottom of the page [here](https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:code:3166:MX).

Currently, searching pycountry subdivisions for MX-CMX turns up a KeyError indicating it's not found. Can you update the source list with the new subdivision code?

Also, I find it concerning that in this instance the ISO change was made several years ago. How often are those changes propagated to the library? Are we unable to assume that pycountry reflects the most recent ISO-3166 standard?

items.title: Attribute error when querying for ceubano 'ceb" iso code
items.body:
pycountry==19.8.18
https://iso639-3.sil.org/code/ceb

=============
`from pycountry import languages
languages.get(alpha_2 = 'ceb').name

AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-43-61362de1da19> in <module>
      1 from pycountry import languages
      2 print(pycountry.Languages)
----> 3 languages.get(alpha_2 = 'ceb').name

AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'name'
`

items.title: HistoricCountries doesn't have a search_fuzzy()
items.body: It's hard to find "Burma" . Wouldn't it be better for `HistoricCountries` to be a subclass of `ExistingCountries` to inherit the `search_fuzzy()` method?

items.title: Typo in languages database
items.body:
Hi,
I've noticed by accident the `alpha_2` country code of Kazakhstan is not correct in the file: 
`pycountry/databases/iso693-3.json`

It's wrongly listed as `kk` although the actual code is `kz`.    
Reference: [Oracle - ISO-3166 Country Codes](https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E13214_01/wli/docs92/xref/xqisocodes.html)

```json
...
    {
      "alpha_2": "kk",
      "alpha_3": "kaz",
      "name": "Kazakh",
      "scope": "I",
      "type": "L"
    },
...
```

items.title: update readme alpha_3 -> alpha3
items.body: It took a small bit of time for me to figure what I was doing wrong, but it turns out the countries alpha_3 property has been renamed to alpha3 but the documentation still references it as alpha_3.

items.title: Support ISO 639-5 from iso-codes
items.body: Please see https://bitbucket.org/flyingcircus/pycountry/issues/13376/support-iso-639-5-from-iso-codes for the details

items.title: subdivision AR-F in Argentina missing
items.body:
Hello,

AR-F (La Rioja) seems to be missing in the subdivisions of Argentina but should exist: https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:code:3166:AR

```
>>> pycountry.subdivisions.get(country_code='AR')
{Subdivision(code='AR-A', country_code='AR', name='Salta', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-B', country_code='AR', name='Buenos Aires', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-C', country_code='AR', name='Ciudad Autónoma de Buenos Aires', parent_code=None, type='City'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-D', country_code='AR', name='San Luis', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-E', country_code='AR', name='Entre Rios', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-G', country_code='AR', name='Santiago del Estero', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-H', country_code='AR', name='Chaco', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-J', country_code='AR', name='San Juan', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-K', country_code='AR', name='Catamarca', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-L', country_code='AR', name='La Pampa', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-M', country_code='AR', name='Mendoza', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-N', country_code='AR', name='Misiones', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-P', country_code='AR', name='Formosa', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-Q', country_code='AR', name='Neuquen', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-R', country_code='AR', name='Rio Negro', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-S', country_code='AR', name='Santa Fe', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-T', country_code='AR', name='Tucuman', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-U', country_code='AR', name='Chubut', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-V', country_code='AR', name='Tierra del Fuego', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
 Subdivision(code='AR-W', country_code='AR', name='Corrientes', parent_code=None, type='Province'),
```

items.title: Implementation of latest ISO_3166-2:DO
items.body:
ISO 3166-2 for Dominican Republic was updated in 2015.
See also http://dominicana.gob.do/index.php/e-municipios/e-localidades/2014-12-16-20-41-38
Pull request: #12 
[Division Territorial 2015.pdf](https://github.com/flyingcircusio/pycountry/files/3928465/Division.Territorial.2015.pdf)

items.title: Documentation updates
items.body:
Hi,

I noticed some super minor code updates on the README and older statements on the project page on pypi. PR coming up

items.title: Lookup always uses slow path
Implementation of latest ISO_3166-2:TW
items.body:
ISO 3166 Maintenance Agency (ISO 3166/MA) has updated in 2016 and late 2018.
See also https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:code:3166:TW
Pull request: https://github.com/flyingcircusio/pycountry/pull/7

items.title: Macedonia can't be found in recent version
items.body:
On py3.7.3

18.12.8:
```python
In [4]: import pycountry

In [5]: country = "Macedonia, Republic of"

In [6]: pycountry.countries.lookup(country).alpha_2
Out[6]: 'MK'
```
19.8.18
```python
In [1]: import pycountry

In [2]: country = 'Macedonia, Republic of'

In [3]: pycountry.countries.lookup(country).alpha_2
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
LookupError                               Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-3-b7cda61645a0> in <module>()
----> 1 pycountry.countries.lookup(country).alpha_2

/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pycountry/db.py in load_if_needed(self, *args, **kw)
     43             with self._load_lock:
     44                 self._load()
---> 45         return f(self, *args, **kw)
     46     return load_if_needed
     47

/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pycountry/db.py in lookup(self, value)
    135                 if v.lower() == value:
    136                     return candidate
--> 137         raise LookupError('Could not find a record for %r' % value)

LookupError: Could not find a record for 'macedonia, republic of'
```

items.title: Module doesn't have __version__
items.body:
```python
In [4]: pycountry.__version__
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-4-7a14c3e623c1> in <module>()
----> 1 pycountry.__version__

AttributeError: module 'pycountry' has no attribute '__version__'
```

I had to resort to `pip list` to find out the version
